intro: Macoubea sprucei, commonly known as the African violet, is a flowering plant native to tropical Africa. It belongs to the Gesneriaceae family and is characterized by its thick, fleshy leaves and showy, tubular flowers. The plant typically grows as a small shrub, reaching heights of up to 30 centimeters. Its flowers come in a variety of colors, including purple, pink, and white, and are often used in ornamental gardening. Macoubea sprucei prefers bright, indirect light and well-draining soil to thrive.
